definitions.definition: To bump lightly, whether accidentally or purposefully.
definitions.example: A racer will often nerf another as a psychological tactic.

definitions.definition: The deterioration, weakening or worsening of a character, a weapon, a spell, etc.
To cripple or weaken an element of a video game during its development (such as a character, a weapon, a spell, etc.).
definitions.example: The lightning spell was originally pretty powerful, but in the sequel they nerfed it so it became completely useless.

definitions.definition: To arbitrarily limit or reduce the capability of.
